member.summary: Represents a set of Cad input options used for document conversion.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a document format.
member.param: The format to convert from.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.CadInputOptions.RenderBackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the drawing when it's rendered. The default is white. Foreground colors in the drawing are corrected automatically when required so that they are always visible on the set background color.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.CadInputOptions.RenderForegroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of the drawing when it's rendered. The default is null, which means foreground colors will be kept same as in the drawing. When set, all foreground colors will be fixed to this same color. For example, you can have a black and white or a blueprint output.

member.summary: Encapsulates all specific information about an individual document conversion.

member.summary: Gets the output file that was specified for the current document conversion.

member.summary: Gets the input options that was specified for the current document conversion.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ConversionContext.OutputOptions
member.summary: Gets the output options that was specified for the current document conversion.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ConversionContext.CurrentPageNumber
member.summary: Gets the current page number being converted. Value is valid only for multi-page output conversions, otherwise it's 0.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ConversionContext.FinalPageNumber
member.summary: Gets the final page number of the current document conversion. Value is valid only for multi-page output conversions, otherwise it's 0.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverterResult
member.summary: Represents the result of a document conversion.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverterResult.OutputFiles
member.summary: Gets the paths of the converted document files. When there is only one output file, the value will be a single item array. If the output is a directory (e.g. for format), the string will have a trailing backslash (\).

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverterResult.ElapsedTime
member.summary: Gets the total elapsed time for the document conversion.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageOutputOptions.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentFormat)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a document format.
member.param: The format to convert to.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageOutputOptions.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets desired resolution for the generated images, in dots per inch (DPI). The default value is 96 DPI. For example, when DPI is 96 and input document page is 8 inches wide, the output image width will be 96*8 = 768 pixels. So the output dimensions (width and height) depends both input document dimensions and DPI.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.IOutputHandler
member.summary: Represents an object for handling of the output files. Implement this interface to provide a custom way of saving the output files.

example.para: Sample IOutputHandler implementation for loading documents:

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.IOutputHandler.OpenWrite(System.String,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ConversionContext)
member.summary: Opens a writable stream for the current output file.
member.param: The current output file. For multi-page output conversions, this wil be pre-formatted with current page number (e.g. Document-01.jpg).
The context which contains useful information for current document conversion.
member.returns: A instance initialized with a writable object.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ISingleOutputHandler
member.summary: Represents an object for handling of a single output file. Implement this interface to provide a custom way of saving an output file when multi-page output conversions can not be supported. Only the first page will be saved when you use this interface.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.MemoryInputOutputHandler
member.summary: Creates an input and output handler whose backing store is memory. This class can be used for in-memory conversions, e.g. you can convert to a document format in memory and then convert from that document format to another via using this handler.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderColumnsFitToPages
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages the columns should fit when it's rendered. The default is 0 which means columns could be broken into multiple pages if required. For example if you set the value 1, all columns would be rendered on a single page.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderRowsFitToPages
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages the rows should fit when it's rendered. The default is 0 which means rows could be broken into multiple pages if required. For example if you set the value 1, all rows would be rendered on a single page.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderHeadings
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether column (e.g. A, B) and row (e.g. 1, 2) headings are rendered on pages. The default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderGridlines
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether cell gridlines are rendered on pages. The default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderTitleColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the columns that contain the cells to be repeated on the left side of each page. For example "$A:$A" specifies first column only and "$A:$C" specifies first, second and third columns.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderTitleRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the rows that contain the cells to be repeated at the top of each page. For example "$1:$1" specifies first row only and "$1:$3" specifies first, second and third rows.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderArea
member.summary: Gets or sets the range to be rendered. For example "A1:K15" specifies a range of A to K columns and 1 to 15 rows.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderBlackAndWhite
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the document will be rendered in black and white. The default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderCenterHorizontally
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the sheet is centered horizontally when rendered. The default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderCenterVertically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the sheet is centered vertically when rendered. The default is false.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark
member.summary: Represents a set of image watermark options used for document conversion.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a image stream.
member.param: The image stream to use as the watermark. The stream will be disposed automatically after it's used.

The version of the image stream, only useful when the watermark is used with DocumentViewer. As the image source is not on disk, information like file date and size will not be available for unique cache key calculation so you can make DocumentViewer know that you changed the source image by manually incrementing this version value. This way DocumentViewer can recognize the change, invalidate the cached document and force watermarking with new image. Instead of incrementing, you can also pass some kind of hash or DateTime.Ticks, of course the value should only change when the image is actually changed.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a instance.
member.param: The bitmap to use as the watermark. The bitmap will be disposed automatically after it's used.

The version of the image bitmap, only useful when the watermark is used with DocumentViewer. As the image source is not on disk, information like file date and size will not be available for unique cache key calculation so you can make DocumentViewer know that you changed the source image by manually incrementing this version value. This way DocumentViewer can recognize the change, invalidate the cached document and force watermarking with new image. Instead of incrementing, you can also pass some kind of hash or DateTime.Ticks, of course the value should only change when the image is actually changed.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PdfOutputOptions.FastWebViewEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether output should be linearized for fast viewing over the web. The default is false. Linearized PDF output (fast web view) has a big advantage when PDFs will be created and placed on a web server as a file. The first page of the PDF displays more quickly because the entire PDF does not need to be downloaded before it can be displayed. Pages can also be requested individually as they are needed while navigating through the document. Linearized PDFs are structured for optimized viewing, meaning the reader will have to do less work to display their content.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how to handle and values. If true, is a percentage of the page width (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) and is a percentage of the page height (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height). If false, and are measured in points.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the watermark; in points or in percentage (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) if is set to true. If also is specified, the resulting width may be smaller than the given one to maintain the aspect ratio. For text watermaks, only percentage values are accepted after setting to true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the watermark; in points or in percentage (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height) if is set to true. member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.SizeIsPercentage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how to handle and values. If true, is a percentage of the page width (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) and is a percentage of the page height (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height). If false, and are measured in points.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation angle in degrees of the watermark.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the watermark. Default is 100. Values are between 0 and 100. Value 0 is invisible, value 100 is fully visible.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.InBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be added as a background layer to a document page. Default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.AnnotationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be added as an annotation to a document page. Default is false. will not work with annotation mode. Note that enabling this property is currently not supported for but it can be enabled when generating PDF documents directly via .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.PrintVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be displayed when printed. Default is true. Note that disabling this property is currently not supported for but it can be disabled when generating PDF documents directly via .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.ScreenVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be displayed on screen. Default is true. Note that disabling this property is currently not supported for but it can be disabled when generating PDF documents directly via .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.PageRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of page numbers to add the watermark to. Default is "all". A string representation of number ranges (e.g. 1-5, 8, 11-13) or keywords (all, even, odd) can be directly assigned to this property.

member.summary: Provides methods for handling caching of documents.

example.para: Pre-caching in the same web application which uses DocumentViewer:
Pre-caching in other applications:

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentUltimateConfiguration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The path to store cached documents. The path should be a physcial path.
The maximum number of days to store cached documents. The default value is 90 days.
Whether encryption of documents should be enabled. The default is true.
Whether to keep variations of document conversion results. The default is false.
The configuration to use instead of the global configuration.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.EncryptionEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether encryption of documents should be enabled. The default is true. Document viewer downloads a special document format on the client-side but for additional security (DRM), the document is also encypted by default.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.KeepVariations
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether to keep variations of document conversion results. The default is false. For instance when you change watermark options, both Pdf and Xpz outputs are regenerated. By default the Pdf and Xpz outputs are replaced in cache when watermarks are changed. If you set this property to true, the Pdf and Xpz outputs will not be replaced but all variations will be kept in cache instead. This can be useful especially when you want different outputs for different users. So this way, for instance you can have different watermarked variations for each different user.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.GetCacheInfo(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentOptions)
member.summary: Gets the cache info for a document. This method can be used if you need to know the cache keys beforehand without calling method.
member.param: The document options of for pre-caching.
member.returns: A new instance.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.SaveCacheInfo(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo)
member.summary: Saves the document cache info.
member.param: The document cache info.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.LoadCacheInfo(GleamTech.Caching.DiskCacheKey)
member.summary: Loads the document cache info that was saved before.
member.param: The cache key for the object.
member.returns: A instance.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.PreCacheDocument(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentOptions)
member.summary: Pre-caches a document. Normally the source document is converted to a special web-friendly format (XPZ) and cached after the document viewer is displayed in the page and when the document is viewed for the first time. With this method, you can do the conversion and caching beforehand so this way, when a user opens the document for the first time, there will be no waiting and the document will be loaded immediately from the cache. If the source document is already converted and cached, then this method will do nothing and return the existing cached item.
member.param: The document options of for pre-caching.
member.returns: A instance for the cached XPZ file, this object contains information like cache key.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.GetOrAddPdf(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo)
member.summary: Gets or adds the PDF cache file. This method handles the first step of the conversion: Source -> PDF. Normally you would not need to call this method directly because calling only method handles the conversion chain Source -> PDF -> XPZ.
member.param: The document cache info.
member.returns: A instance for the cached PDF file, this object contains information like cache key.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCache.GetOrAddXpz(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo)
member.summary: Gets or adds the XPZ cache file. This method handles the second step of the conversion: PDF -> XPZ. Normally you would not need to call this method directly because calling only method handles the conversion chain Source -> PDF -> XPZ.
member.param: The document cache info.
member.returns: A instance for the cached XPZ file, this object contains information like cache key.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo.CachePdfKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for PDF. This key corresponds to the cache item which is the first step of the conversion: Source -> PDF. This format is used both as an input to XPZ and as the file for "Download as PDF" button.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo.CacheXpzKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for XPZ. This key corresponds to the cache item which is the second step of the conversion: PDF -> XPZ. This format is the web-friendly format used by the DocumentViewer.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo.CacheInfoKey

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentCacheInfo.CacheCopyKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for the copy of the source. This key is used only when the source needs to be serialized. The source stream is copied to the cache folder for serialization. This is currently done when you use so that your source is available out of the context of your page that hosts .

member.summary: Represents the result of method.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentInfo.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentFormat})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The unique identifier that will be used for generating the cache key for this document. For instance, it can be an ID from your database table or a simple file name; you just need to make sure this ID varies for each different document so that they are cached correctly. For example for files on disk, we internally use a string combination of file extension, file size and file date for uniquely identifying them, this way cache collisions do not occur and we can resuse the cached file even if the file name before extension is changed (because it's still the same document).

The file name which will be used for display purposes such as when downloading the document within or for the subfolder name prefix in cache folder. It will also be used to determine the document format from extension if parameter is not specified. If not specified or empty, will be used as the file name.

The format of the document. If not specified, the format will be automatically determined from the file extension in or . If your file name does not have an extension, you should explictly specify the correct format so that can correctly load the document.

member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the document.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the collection of the text or image watermarks to embed to the displayed document. Downloading as PDF will also include the same watermarks.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentOptions.InputOptions
member.summary: Gets the collection of input options used when generating the displayed document. For example, when you add an instance of to this collection, it will be used only for spreadsheet input files.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentOptions.Document
member.summary: Gets or sets the document to load and display. This is usually the path to the document to load. Both physical (eg. c:\document.docx) and virtual (eg. /document.docx or ~/document.docx) paths are supported. If a custom document handler is provided via property, then this value will be passed to that handler which should open and return a readable stream according to this file identifier. So it can be any string value that your implementation understands.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentOptions.DocumentHandlerType
member.summary: Gets or sets the document handler type which provides a custom way of loading the input files. This class should implement interface and should have a parameterless constructor so that it can be instantiated internally when necessary. Value of property will be passed to this handler which should open and return a readable stream according to that file identifier. So it can be any string value that your implementation understands.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentOptions.DocumentSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the document source to load and display. This is an alternative to property. When you don't have a file on disk and implementing interface is not convenient, you can use this property to load documents from a stream or a byte array.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentOptions.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password which is used for loading a protected document.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentOptions.HighQualityEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to render high quality within DocumentViewer. The default is false. For providing some guarantees regarding how quickly a page can be rendered on different systems such as mobile devices, by default some parts of a page that are very complex and would take really long to render in the browser, are rasterized to an image (flattened). However as a side effect, parts of some pages may look blurry when you zoom in. You can set this property to true to disable this possible flattening (if you observe it's happening with your specific document). This way you can ensure vector quality rendering for complex documents such as CAD drawings. If you have errors due to insufficient memory, keep it at false. This setting does not effect the first step of the conversion: Source -> PDF, it only effects the second step of the conversion: PDF -> XPZ.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource
member.summary: Defines a document that can be loaded either from a stream or a byte array. This class is a convenient alternative to interface which requires the developer to maintain the state. However with this class you can load a stream or a byte array that is only available in the context of your host page. is more robust but this class is easier to use. Note that your stream or byte array will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists when you load via because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed).

example.para: Load document from a stream:
Initializing a DocumentInfo instance:
Load document from a byte array:
Load document from a stream callback:
Load document from a byte array callback:

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentInfo,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.StreamResult)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document stream.
member.param: The object which contains necessary info to identify the document.

The stream containing the document. The stream is not required to be seekable because it will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists. This is because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed).

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentInfo,System.Func{GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.StreamResult})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document stream callback.
member.param: The object which contains necessary info to identify the document.

The callback method to return an opened stream containing the document. The returned stream is not required to be seekable because it will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists. This is because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed). This callback will only be called when necessary, i.e. if the stream is already cached before then the callback will not be called. You can prefer callback over a direct instance when you need extra performance; consider opening the stream is costly in your implementation, for example you are retrieving it from network or a database or even from a zip file so opening the stream only when it's really necessary would be more performant when your document is viewed several times by several users.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentInfo,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document byte array.
member.param: The object which contains necessary info to identify the document.

The byte array containing the document. This byte array will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists. This is because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed).

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentSource.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Web.DocumentInfo,System.Func{System.Byte[]})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document byte array callback.
member.param: The object which contains necessary info to identify the document.

The callback method to return a byte array containing the document. The returned byte array will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists. This is because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed). This callback will only be called when necessary, i.e. if the byte array is already cached before then the callback will not be called. You can prefer callback over a direct instance when you need extra performance; consider retrieving the byte array is costly in your implementation, for example you are retrieving it from network or a database or even from a zip file so retrieving the byte array only when it's really necessary would be more performant when your document is viewed several times by several users.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter
member.summary: Provides methods for converting between document file formats.

example.para: You can use static Convert method to easily convert an input document to another format:
You can use static CanConvert method to check beforehand if an input document can be directly converted another format:

You can also create an instance of DocumentConverter class with an input document and call instance methods ConvertTo and CanConvertTo. This is useful especially when you want to convert the same input document to several output formats:
You can enumerate possible output document formats for a given input document file with EnumeratePossibleOutputFormats method and vice versa with EnumeratePossibleInputFormats method:

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter.ConvertTo(System.IO.Stream,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentFormat,System.Nullable{GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentEngine})
member.summary: Converts the document file to another format with the specified output stream and format. For multi-page output conversions, only the first page will be saved to the stream as it would be useless to save all pages to the same stream. Use overloads with output stream callback for full control over multi-page output conversions.
member.param: The stream to write the converted document file.
The target format to convert the document file to.
The document engine to force. If not specified, the best document engine will be chosen automatically according to the input and output formats.
member.returns: A object that contains the result of the document conversion such as output file paths.

example.para: Converting to an output stream:

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.WordProcessingInputOptions.FieldFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to be used for the FileName field in a Word document. When the input is a file on disk, this field is automatically updated to the original file name when saved. However when the input is a stream, the file name will not be known so you can set this property to make sure FileName field contains the correct file name.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.XpzOutputOptions.HighQualityEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to produce high quality XPZ. The default is false. For providing some guarantees regarding how quickly a page can be rendered on different systems such as mobile devices, by default some parts of a page that are very complex and would take really long to render in the browser, are rasterized to an image (flattened). However as a side effect, parts of some pages may look blurry when you zoom in. You can set this property to true to disable this possible flattening (if you observe it's happening with your specific document). This way you can ensure vector quality rendering for complex documents such as CAD drawings. If you have errors due to insufficient memory, keep it at false.
